item.description:
Cinema City is doing a series of classic movies on Sundays at 11:00am. I am going to schedule meetups for all of them even if I cannot attend, to let people know about them.

"American In Paris" has music, dancing, scenery, and of course Gene Kelly. What more does a woman need in the morning? For those not familiar with the movie, here's a very brief summary: "Gerry (Gene Kelly) is an American expatriate painter in post-WWII Paris. Struggling to find success in both art and love, his life is turned upside down when he meets and falls in love with Lise (Leslie Caron). This lavish musical won the Best Picture Oscar in 1951 with its straightforward story, gorgeous dance sequences, and beautiful, frequently melancholic Gershwin score." And that quick summary doesn't tell you about all the other characters and their stories as they wind through Paris.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: "An American in Paris" - Cine Classics at Cinema City at the Palace
